item.title: Neon Doctrine founders establish Goldpact Goblins
item.content:encoded:
A brand-new games services outfit.

Following the dissolution of Neon Doctrine in October 2025, founders Vladislav Tsopljak and Iain Garner have announced the establishment of Goldpact Goblins, offering “community first” solutions tailored for studios seeking support in community management, marketing, social media outreach, production, business development, focus testing, quality assurance, branding, and strategy.

“One of the reasons we decided on a tailored solutions approach is because the current revenue share and recoup models don’t work for all teams,” said Goldpact Goblins CEO Vladislav Tsopljak in a press release. “We’ve seen it happen many times, especially in Southeast Asia, China, and South America, where a developer finds success but isn’t the next big thing. However, due to industry-standard revenue splits, aggressive recoup models, and passive investors, the devs see income months later and are a sadly small slice of the pie, often that is enough to shut down a promising studio. We want to provide a sustainable model that helps the local industry grow and thrive and allows developers to keep their gold in their pockets after launch.”

Goldpact Goblins president Iain Garner added, “What we’ve learned is that the heart of almost every successful game is a thriving community and our unique strategies are designed to help studios build, understand, and support communities that survive and thrive long after the Goblins have left the building.”

Since forming on January 1, Goldpact Goblins has established partnerships with the following games and studios:

  • Deadly Rehearsal (Kaigan Games)
  • Grim Trials (Glory Jam)
  • Just A Shadow Game (IndieLab)
  • Lost Castle 2 (Hunter Studio)
  • Spook-A-Boo (Wala Interactive)
  • TCG Card Shop Simulator (OPNeon Games)

While Goldpact Goblins’ capacity for full service projects is already filled, it remains available for short-term consultancy, and will be able to offer full support for new developer projects after July 2026.

Visit the company’s official website here.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/neon-doctrine-founders-establish-goldpact-goblins

item.title: Pure Pool Pro launches February 12 for PS5 and PC, this spring for Xbox Series
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

"Feel the peak of cue sports."

Native 8K cue sports simulation game Pure Pool Pro will launch for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam on February 12, followed by Xbox Series and PC via Epic Games Store this spring, publisher Ripstone and developer Rockwater announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Ripstone:

About

Feel the peak of cue sports in Pure Pool Pro, sequel to the acclaimed Pure Pool. Experience stunning visuals at up to 8K native on PlayStation 5 Pro and high-end PC, high-fidelity reflections, and an enhanced physics engine tuned for lifelike spin, swerve, and shot control—delivering the most tactile, responsive, and satisfying cue sports experience yet.

Key Features

  • Cutting-Edge Visuals – Experience lifelike lighting, high-fidelity reflections, and intricate table and ball details that make every shot look and feel real.
    • Native 8K resolution / 60 frames per second visuals on PlayStation 5 Pro and high-end PC.
    • Native 4K resolution / 120 frames per second performance mode on PlayStation 5, PlayStation 5 Pro, and PC.
    • Fully native rendering—no upscaling techniques used.
    • High-fidelity, software-based reflections.
  • Career Mode – Build your legacy by progressing through hundreds of events across US 8-Ball and US 9-Ball career modes.
  • Seamless Online Cross-Play – Compete in real-time matches with friends and rivals worldwide, no matter their platform. Rise to the top of global leaderboards.
  • Lifelike AI Opponents – Challenge 20 unique AI players, each with distinct personalities, signature cues, and adaptive strategies that keep you on your toes.
  • Two Iconic Venues – Play in the futuristic, 1,000-seat Tetradome arena or the luxurious Rackhaus pool hall, each offering a distinct atmosphere.
  • Challenge Modes – Sharpen your skills in high-energy mini-games like Speed Pot, Checkpoint, Daily Clearance, Perfect Potter, and Royal Rumble.
  • Customization and Unlocks – Unlock cues, balls, baize colors, and table designs, plus earn exclusive profile crests through precision play.
  • Huge Soundtrack – Over 80 tracks from smooth jazz to high-energy beats, chosen to heighten every moment from relaxed practice to intense competition.
  • Local Play Modes – Jump into local matches across various game types to ramp up the heat IRL.

Watch a new trailer below.

Features Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/pure-pool-pro-launches-february-12-for-ps5-and-pc-this-spring-for-xbox-series
